intro: Mentha scopoliana, commonly known as the Spanish mint, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale purple to blue and appear in whorls along the stem. Mentha scopoliana is known for its strong menthol scent and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported antispasmodic and analgesic properties.
